ICYMI: Check out Chairman @RepCummings first opening statement of the 116th Congress on the examination of drug companies actions in the rise of prescription drugs. 
Watch Now! https://youtu.be/kh4GBp9aAP0

In The News:🏛️Senior lawmakers from both parties target rising drug prices in hearings 💊 https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/senior-lawmakers-parties-target-rising-drug-prices-hearings/story?id=60699390 …
📸Check out our Members in action during our first hearing held today to examine the actions of drug companies in raising drug prices.🏛 pic.twitter.com/ybZraga4UT

"Our constituents are DEMANDING it.  

And I am grateful that we are finally starting down that road with today’s hearing." -@RepCummings

"But the bottom line is that the ongoing escalation of prices by drug companies is simply unsustainable.  

This is a matter of life and death, and we have a duty to act NOW. "

"We all recognize that research and development efforts on groundbreaking medications have made immeasurable contributions to the health of Americans, including new treatments and cures for diseases that have affected people for centuries."

"Let me be clear:  there are powerful interests here that do not want us to interfere with their massive profits. 

But there is a strong bipartisan consensus that we must do something to rein in out-of-control price increases."

"The pharmaceutical industry is one of the most profitable in the world—and one of the most POWERFUL.

Fourteen drug companies each made more than $1 billion in profits just in the third quarter of 2018.  And they have the best lobbyists money can buy. "

"We have seen time after time that #drugcompanies make money hand over fist by raising the prices of their drugs—often without justification, and sometimes overnight—while patients are left holding the bill."

"I have been waiting a very long time to hold this hearing.  

For the past decade, I have been trying to investigate the actions of #drugcompanies for all sorts of drugs—old and new, generic and brand-name."
"We also value the expert testimony of Dr. Jerry Anderson, Dr. Aaron Kesselheim, and Dr. Avik Roy."

"I also want to thank our other witnesses for being here today.  

We are grateful to have Dr. Catherine Georges of @AARP to speak on behalf of America’s #seniors. "
"So, when you testify here today, you are representing thousands and thousands of your fellow Americans who are suffering from the same worsening problem. "

Researchers at Yale University recently found that one in four patients with Type 1 or Type 2 Diabetes and I quote, 

“have reported using less insulin than prescribed.”

"Ms. Worsham, it’s not easy to testify before Congress, and you are very courageous.  

I want to thank you for being here to share your family’s story with us.  

You are not alone. "

"The first witness to testify before the Oversight Committee is Antroinette Worsham.  

Ms. Worsham is a working mother whose daughter died tragically when she could not afford to pay for the insulin she needed to treat her diabetes and instead began to ration her medicine."

"Two weeks ago, the Committee launched an investigation into #prescriptiondrugprices to determine why #drugcompanies are increasing prices so dramatically, how #drugcompanies are using the proceeds, and what steps can be taken to reduce #prescriptiondrugprices."

"But today, for our first hearing, I wanted to focus on one of the biggest problems facing American families across the country—the actions of #drugcompanies that have been AGGRESSIVELY increasing prices on existing drugs and setting higher launch prices for new drugs!"
"And the latest of #PresidentTrump’s longtime advisers has been INDICTED on criminal charges."

"Until last Friday, the federal government was in the middle of the LONGEST #shutdown in U.S. history.  

Hundreds of #immigrantchildren—and possibly many more—are still SEPARATED from their families."
"Before we begin, I acknowledge that there is A LOT going on right now—here on Capitol Hill and across the country."

"Today, we will examine the actions of #drugcompanies in raising #prescriptiondrugprices in the United States, as well as the effects of these actions on federal and state budgets and on American families."
"I know we are taking on a lot today, but I truly believe this is one of the most important issues facing our constituents, and it is one that demands immediate attention!"
"Welcome to the first hearing of the Committee on Oversight and Reform for the 116th Congress. " - Chairman @RepCummings Opening Statement

”The American people deserve that.
 
And I will do everything I can to help deliver that for them.” - @RepCummings
”We need real and immediate action to lower drug prices in this country.”

”They should not have to decide between paying their bills or paying for their prescriptions.  
 
We’re a better country than that.”

”No more talk.
 
No more tweets.
 
The American people want action!”
”These bills are important because it’s time to provide much-needed relief to the American people.”
”I’m also reintroducing the Affordable and Safe Prescription Drug Importation Act, to allow Americans to buy safe affordable prescription drugs from other countries.”

”So today, I’m here to reintroduce the Medicare Drug Price Negotiation Act, co-led by my friends Representatives Welch and Doggett, to allow Medicare to negotiate prices directly with drug companies.”
”Another study found that most widely-used brand name drugs have more than doubled in price since 2006.”
”A poll found that one in five Americans reported not filling a prescription due to high costs.”
”And unfortunately, there hasn’t been any progress since then, and it’s clear the problem is getting worse.”

”We asked for his endorsement. 
 
We asked for his support.
 
He NEVER responded.”
”We gave him the same bill we’re reintroducing today, the Medicare Drug Price Negotiation Act. ”

”I, along with Rep. Welch, even met with President Trump.

We went to the White House—early in the President’s first year. ”
I’ve held hearings, written letters, and pleaded with my Republican colleagues to address this issue.”
”I have been investigating the skyrocketing prices of drugs since 2011—for both generic and brand name drugs.”
”Ladies and gentlemen, I’m here today as a long-time advocate of lowering #drugprices for the American people. ”
”Thank you to Senator Sanders and to all my colleagues here today who have been leaders on this issue.” -@RepCummings #LowerDrugPrices

ICYMI: @RepCummings joined alongside @NancyPelosi, @RepSarbanes and @HouseDemocrats to unveil the #ForeThePeople Act which will strengthen accountability for Executive Branch officials. Full Release:  https://oversight.house.gov/news/press-releases/chairman-cummings-issues-statement-on-hr- … pic.twitter.com/xlYeKjniX8
News Alert: @RepCummings named Oversight Committee Chairman. Full Release📍  https://oversight.house.gov/news/press-releases/cummings-named-oversight-committee-chairman … pic.twitter.com/1LdTUoC7fm
“I look forward to passing all of the strong reforms in #HR1. This is OUR watch, and the American people are looking for us to take action!” -@RepCummings
“6. Requiring senior government officials to disclose political contributions they received before joining the government”
“5. Making any waivers from ethics rules available to the American people”
“4. Strengthening the government’s ethics watchdog, the Office of Government Ethics, and making it more independent”
“3. Prohibiting procurement officers from going to work for companies they awarded contracts to for at least two years after they leave”
“2. Prohibiting executive branch officials from lobbying their own agencies for two years after they leave”
“1. Requiring the President to disclose his financial interests as soon as he takes office”
“Here is what we will be focusing on in the Oversight Committee:”
“That is why we are introducing the #ForthePeople Act.  This bill includes a number of reforms that will strengthen accountability for Executive Branch officials—including the President.”
“We have seen gross abuses from agency heads such as former #EPA  Administrator #ScottPruitt and former  #Interior Secretary #RyanZinke.”
“Over the last two years, #PresidentTrump set the tone from the top in his Administration that behaving ethically and complying with the law is optional.”

“The midterm elections were monumental and historic.  The American people gave #Congress a mandate to finally start conducting credible oversight and enacting reforms.” - @RepCummings pic.twitter.com/xb4fQzwurE
